body_html:
Hello, @soumith @zou3519
I met this problem yesterday, I am pretty sure my code is right. There is something wrong with HingeEmbeddingLoss.

below is an example:

import torch
from torch import nn
from torch.autograd import Variable

a = torch.FloatTensor([1, 2, 3]).unsqueeze(0)
b = torch.FloatTensor([3, 4, 5]).unsqueeze(0)
a, b = Variable(a), Variable(b)
distance = nn.PairwiseDistance()(a, b)
loss = nn.HingeEmbeddingLoss(2.0)(distance, Variable(torch.LongTensor([1])))

Hope someone could fix this problem and make pytorch better!

body:
Hello, @soumith @zou3519 
I met this problem yesterday, I am pretty sure my code is right. There is something wrong with **HingeEmbeddingLoss**.

below is an example:
```python
import torch
from torch import nn
from torch.autograd import Variable

a = torch.FloatTensor([1, 2, 3]).unsqueeze(0)
b = torch.FloatTensor([3, 4, 5]).unsqueeze(0)
a, b = Variable(a), Variable(b)
distance = nn.PairwiseDistance()(a, b)
loss = nn.HingeEmbeddingLoss(2.0)(distance, Variable(torch.LongTensor([1])))
```
Hope someone could fix this problem and make pytorch better!
